service:
Welcome to the AWS Audit Manager API reference. This guide is for developers who need detailed information about the AWS Audit Manager API operations, data types, and errors.

AWS Audit Manager is a service that provides automated evidence collection so that you can continuously audit your AWS usage, and assess the effectiveness of your controls to better manage risk and simplify compliance.

AWS Audit Manager provides pre-built frameworks that structure and automate assessments for a given compliance standard. Frameworks include a pre-built collection of controls with descriptions and testing procedures, which are grouped according to the requirements of the specified compliance standard or regulation. You can also customize frameworks and controls to support internal audits with unique requirements.

Use the following links to get started with the AWS Audit Manager API:

  • Actions: An alphabetical list of all AWS Audit Manager API operations.

  • Data types: An alphabetical list of all AWS Audit Manager data types.

  • Common parameters: Parameters that all Query operations can use.

  • Common errors: Client and server errors that all operations can return.

If you're new to AWS Audit Manager, we recommend that you review the AWS Audit Manager User Guide.

operations.AssociateAssessmentReportEvidenceFolder: Associates an evidence folder to the specified assessment report in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.BatchAssociateAssessmentReportEvidence: Associates a list of evidence to an assessment report in an AWS Audit Manager assessment.
operations.BatchCreateDelegationByAssessment: Create a batch of delegations for a specified assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.BatchDeleteDelegationByAssessment: Deletes the delegations in the specified AWS Audit Manager assessment.
operations.BatchDisassociateAssessmentReportEvidenc: Disassociates a list of evidence from the specified assessment report in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.BatchImportEvidenceToAssessmentControl: Uploads one or more pieces of evidence to the specified control in the assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.CreateAssessment: Creates an assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.CreateAssessmentFramework: Creates a custom framework in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.CreateAssessmentReport: Creates an assessment report for the specified assessment.
operations.CreateControl: Creates a new custom control in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.DeleteAssessment: Deletes an assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.DeleteAssessmentFramework: Deletes a custom framework in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.DeleteAssessmentReport: Deletes an assessment report from an assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.DeleteControl: Deletes a custom control in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.DeregisterAccount: Deregisters an account in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.DeregisterOrganizationAdminAccount: Deregisters the delegated AWS administrator account from the AWS organization.
operations.DisassociateAssessmentReportEvidenceFold: Disassociates an evidence folder from the specified assessment report in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetAccountStatus: Returns the registration status of an account in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetAssessment: Returns an assessment from AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetAssessmentFramework: Returns a framework from AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetAssessmentReportUrl: Returns the URL of a specified assessment report in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetChangeLogs: Returns a list of changelogs from AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetControl: Returns a control from AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetDelegations: Returns a list of delegations from an audit owner to a delegate.
operations.GetEvidence: Returns evidence from AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetEvidenceByEvidenceFolder: Returns all evidence from a specified evidence folder in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetEvidenceFolder: Returns an evidence folder from the specified assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetEvidenceFoldersByAssessment: Returns the evidence folders from a specified assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetEvidenceFoldersByAssessmentControl: Returns a list of evidence folders associated with a specified control of an assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.GetOrganizationAdminAccount: Returns the name of the delegated AWS administrator account for the AWS organization.
operations.GetServicesInScope: Returns a list of the in-scope AWS services for the specified assessment.
operations.GetSettings: Returns the settings for the specified AWS account.
operations.ListAssessmentFrameworks: Returns a list of the frameworks available in the AWS Audit Manager framework library.
operations.ListAssessmentReports: Returns a list of assessment reports created in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.ListAssessments: Returns a list of current and past assessments from AWS Audit Manager.
operations.ListControls: Returns a list of controls from AWS Audit Manager.
operations.ListKeywordsForDataSource: Returns a list of keywords that pre-mapped to the specified control data source.
operations.ListNotifications: Returns a list of all AWS Audit Manager notifications.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Returns a list of tags for the specified resource in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.RegisterAccount: Enables AWS Audit Manager for the specified AWS account.
operations.RegisterOrganizationAdminAccount: Enables an AWS account within the organization as the delegated administrator for AWS Audit Manager.
operations.TagResource: Tags the specified resource in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.UntagResource: Removes a tag from a resource in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.UpdateAssessment: Edits an AWS Audit Manager assessment.
operations.UpdateAssessmentControl: Updates a control within an assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.UpdateAssessmentControlSetStatus: Updates the status of a control set in an AWS Audit Manager assessment.
operations.UpdateAssessmentFramework: Updates a custom framework in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.UpdateAssessmentStatus: Updates the status of an assessment in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.UpdateControl: Updates a custom control in AWS Audit Manager.
operations.UpdateSettings: Updates AWS Audit Manager settings for the current user account.
operations.ValidateAssessmentReportIntegrity: Validates the integrity of an assessment report in AWS Audit Manager.

AWSAccount.base: The wrapper of AWS account details, such as account ID, email address, and so on.

refs.Assessment$awsAccount: The AWS account associated with the assessment.

refs.Scope$awsAccounts: The AWS accounts included in the scope of the assessment.

AWSService.base: An AWS service such as Amazon S3, AWS CloudTrail, and so on.

refs.AWSService$serviceName: The name of the AWS service.
refs.Evidence$eventSource: The AWS service from which the evidence is collected.
refs.ServiceMetadata$name: The name of the AWS service.

refs.Scope$awsServices: The AWS services included in the scope of the assessment.

AccessDeniedException.base: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

refs.DeregisterOrganizationAdminAccountReques: The identifier for the specified administrator account.

refs.RegisterOrganizationAdminAccountRequest$: The identifier for the specified delegated administrator account.
refs.RegisterOrganizationAdminAccountResponse: The identifier for the specified delegated administrator account.

refs.AWSAccount$name: The name of the specified AWS account.

refs.DeregisterAccountResponse$status: The registration status of the account.
refs.GetAccountStatusResponse$status: The status of the specified AWS account.
refs.RegisterAccountResponse$status: The status of the account registration request.

refs.Control$actionPlanInstructions: The recommended actions to carry out if the control is not fulfilled.
refs.CreateControlRequest$actionPlanInstructi: The recommended actions to carry out if the control is not fulfilled.
refs.UpdateControlRequest$actionPlanInstructi: The recommended actions to carry out if the control is not fulfilled.

refs.CreateControlRequest$actionPlanTitle: The title of the action plan for remediating the control.
refs.UpdateControlRequest$actionPlanTitle: The title of the action plan for remediating the control.

Assessment.base: An entity that defines the scope of audit evidence collected by AWS Audit Manager. An AWS Audit Manager assessment is an implementation of an AWS Audit Manager framework.

refs.UpdateAssessmentResponse$assessment: The response object (name of the updated assessment) for the UpdateAssessmentRequest API.
refs.UpdateAssessmentStatusResponse$assessmen: The name of the updated assessment returned by the UpdateAssessmentStatus API.

AssessmentControl.base: The control entity that represents a standard or custom control used in an AWS Audit Manager assessment.

refs.UpdateAssessmentControlResponse$control: The name of the updated control set returned by the UpdateAssessmentControl API.

AssessmentControlSet.base: Represents a set of controls in an AWS Audit Manager assessment.

refs.UpdateAssessmentControlSetStatusResponse: The name of the updated control set returned by the UpdateAssessmentControlSetStatus API.

refs.AssessmentFramework$controlSets: The control sets associated with the framework.

refs.AssessmentControlSet$controls: The list of controls contained with the control set.

refs.CreateAssessmentRequest$description: The optional description of the assessment to be created.
refs.UpdateAssessmentRequest$assessmentDescri: The description of the specified assessment.

AssessmentEvidenceFolder.base: The folder in which AWS Audit Manager stores evidence for an assessment.

refs.GetEvidenceFolderResponse$evidenceFolder: The folder in which evidence is stored.

refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$name: The name of the specified evidence folder.

refs.GetEvidenceFoldersByAssessmentControlRes: The list of evidence folders returned by the GetEvidenceFoldersByAssessmentControl API.
refs.GetEvidenceFoldersByAssessmentResponse$e: The list of evidence folders returned by the GetEvidenceFoldersByAssessment API.

AssessmentFramework.base: The file used to structure and automate AWS Audit Manager assessments for a given compliance standard.

refs.Assessment$framework: The framework from which the assessment was created.

AssessmentFrameworkMetadata.base: The metadata associated with a standard or custom framework.

AssessmentMetadata.base: The metadata associated with the specified assessment.

refs.Assessment$metadata: The metadata for the specified assessment.

AssessmentMetadataItem.base: A metadata object associated with an assessment in AWS Audit Manager.

refs.AssessmentReport$assessmentName: The name of the associated assessment.
refs.CreateAssessmentRequest$name: The name of the assessment to be created.
refs.Delegation$assessmentName: The name of the associated assessment.
refs.DelegationMetadata$assessmentName: The name of the associated assessment.
refs.Notification$assessmentName: The name of the related assessment.
refs.UpdateAssessmentRequest$assessmentName: The name of the specified assessment to be updated.

AssessmentReport.base: A finalized document generated from an AWS Audit Manager assessment. These reports summarize the relevant evidence collected for your audit, and link to the relevant evidence folders which are named and organized according to the controls specified in your assessment.

refs.CreateAssessmentReportResponse$assessmen: The new assessment report returned by the CreateAssessmentReport API.

refs.AssessmentReport$description: The description of the specified assessment report.
refs.AssessmentReportMetadata$description: The description of the specified assessment report.
refs.CreateAssessmentReportRequest$descriptio: The description of the assessment report.

refs.AssessmentReportsDestination$destination: The destination type, such as Amazon S3.

refs.BatchAssociateAssessmentReportEvidenceRe: A list of errors returned by the BatchAssociateAssessmentReportEvidence API.
refs.BatchDisassociateAssessmentReportEvidenc: A list of errors returned by the BatchDisassociateAssessmentReportEvidence API.

AssessmentReportMetadata.base: The metadata objects associated with the specified assessment report.

refs.AssessmentReport$name: The name given to the assessment report.
refs.AssessmentReportMetadata$name: The name of the assessment report.
refs.CreateAssessmentReportRequest$name: The name of the new assessment report.

refs.AssessmentReport$status: The current status of the specified assessment report.
refs.AssessmentReportMetadata$status: The current status of the assessment report.

AssessmentReportsDestination.base: The location in which AWS Audit Manager saves assessment reports for the given assessment.

refs.AssessmentMetadata$assessmentReportsDest: The destination in which evidence reports are stored for the specified assessment.
refs.CreateAssessmentRequest$assessmentReport: The assessment report storage destination for the specified assessment that is being created.
refs.Settings$defaultAssessmentReportsDestina: The default storage destination for assessment reports.
refs.UpdateAssessmentRequest$assessmentReport: The assessment report storage destination for the specified assessment that is being updated.
refs.UpdateSettingsRequest$defaultAssessmentR: The default storage destination for assessment reports.

refs.AssessmentMetadata$status: The overall status of the assessment.
refs.AssessmentMetadataItem$status: The current status of the assessment.
refs.UpdateAssessmentStatusRequest$status: The current status of the specified assessment.

refs.Assessment$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the assessment.
refs.AssessmentFramework$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified framework.

refs.Settings$isAwsOrgEnabled: Specifies whether AWS Organizations is enabled.

refs.Framework$complianceType: The compliance type that the new custom framework supports, such as CIS or HIPAA.

refs.UpdateAssessmentFrameworkRequest$complia: The compliance type that the new custom framework supports, such as CIS or HIPAA.

Control.base: A control in AWS Audit Manager.

refs.CreateControlResponse$control: The new control returned by the CreateControl API.
refs.GetControlResponse$control: The name of the control returned by the GetControl API.
refs.UpdateControlResponse$control: The name of the updated control set returned by the UpdateControl API.

refs.ControlMetadata$name: The name of the specified control.
refs.UpdateControlRequest$name: The name of the control to be updated.

refs.AssessmentControl$response: The response of the specified control.

ControlSet.base: A set of controls in AWS Audit Manager.

refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$controlSetId: The identifier for the control set.
refs.BatchImportEvidenceToAssessmentControlRe: The identifier for the specified control set.
refs.CreateDelegationRequest$controlSetId: The unique identifier for the control set.
refs.Delegation$controlSetId: The identifier for the associated control set.
refs.GetChangeLogsRequest$controlSetId: The identifier for the specified control set.
refs.GetEvidenceByEvidenceFolderRequest$contr: The identifier for the control set.
refs.GetEvidenceFolderRequest$controlSetId: The identifier for the specified control set.

refs.ControlSet$name: The name of the control set.
refs.CreateAssessmentFrameworkControlSet$name: The name of the specified control set.
refs.UpdateAssessmentFrameworkControlSet$name: The name of the control set.

refs.AssessmentControlSet$status: Specifies the current status of the control set.
refs.UpdateAssessmentControlSetStatusRequest$: The status of the control set that is being updated.

refs.Framework$controlSets: The control sets associated with the framework.

refs.AssessmentFrameworkMetadata$controlSetsC: The number of control sets associated with the specified framework.

refs.Control$controlSources: The data source that determines from where AWS Audit Manager collects evidence for the control.
refs.ControlMetadata$controlSources: The data source that determines from where AWS Audit Manager collects evidence for the control.
refs.Framework$controlSources: The sources from which AWS Audit Manager collects evidence for the control.

refs.AssessmentControl$status: The status of the specified control.
refs.UpdateAssessmentControlRequest$controlSt: The status of the specified control.

refs.Control$type: The type of control, such as custom or standard.
refs.ListControlsRequest$controlType: The type of control, such as standard or custom.

refs.ControlSet$controls: The list of controls within the control set.

refs.AssessmentFrameworkMetadata$controlsCoun: The number of controls associated with the specified framework.

CreateAssessmentFrameworkControl.base: Control entity attributes that uniquely identify an existing control to be added to a framework in AWS Audit Manager.

CreateAssessmentFrameworkControlSet.base: A controlSet entity that represents a collection of controls in AWS Audit Manager. This does not contain the control set ID.

refs.CreateAssessmentFrameworkRequest$control: The control sets to be associated with the framework.

refs.CreateAssessmentFrameworkControlSet$cont: The list of controls within the control set. This does not contain the control set ID.
refs.UpdateAssessmentFrameworkControlSet$cont: The list of controls contained within the control set.

CreateControlMappingSource.base: Control mapping fields that represent the source for evidence collection, along with related parameters and metadata. This does not contain mappingID.

refs.CreateControlRequest$controlMappingSourc: The data mapping sources for the specified control.

CreateDelegationRequest.base: A collection of attributes used to create a delegation for an assessment in AWS Audit Manager.

refs.BatchCreateDelegationByAssessmentError$c: The API request to batch create delegations in AWS Audit Manager.

refs.BatchCreateDelegationByAssessmentRequest: The API request to batch create delegations in AWS Audit Manager.

refs.Control$createdBy: The IAM user or role that created the control.
refs.Delegation$createdBy: The IAM user or role that created the delegation.
refs.Framework$createdBy: The IAM user or role that created the framework.

Delegation.base: The assignment of a control set to a delegate for review.

refs.Delegation$comment: The comment related to the delegation.
refs.UpdateAssessmentControlSetStatusRequest$: The comment related to the status update.

refs.BatchDeleteDelegationByAssessmentRequest: The identifiers for the specified delegations.

DelegationMetadata.base: The metadata associated with the specified delegation.

refs.GetDelegationsResponse$delegations: The list of delegations returned by the GetDelegations API.

refs.DelegationMetadata$status: The current status of the delgation.

refs.AssessmentControlSet$delegations: The delegations associated with the control set.
refs.AssessmentMetadata$delegations: The delegations associated with the assessment.
refs.AssessmentMetadataItem$delegations: The delegations associated with the assessment.
refs.BatchCreateDelegationByAssessmentRespons: The delegations associated with the assessment.

refs.AWSAccount$emailAddress: The email address associated with the specified AWS account.

refs.AssessmentReportEvidenceError$errorCode: The error code returned by the AssessmentReportEvidence API.
refs.BatchCreateDelegationByAssessmentError$e: The error code returned by the BatchCreateDelegationByAssessment API.
refs.BatchDeleteDelegationByAssessmentError$e: The error code returned by the BatchDeleteDelegationByAssessment API.
refs.BatchImportEvidenceToAssessmentControlEr: The error code returned by the BatchImportEvidenceToAssessmentControl API.

refs.AssessmentReportEvidenceError$errorMessa: The error message returned by the AssessmentReportEvidence API.
refs.BatchCreateDelegationByAssessmentError$e: The error message returned by the BatchCreateDelegationByAssessment API.
refs.BatchDeleteDelegationByAssessmentError$e: The error message returned by the BatchDeleteDelegationByAssessment API.
refs.BatchImportEvidenceToAssessmentControlEr: The error message returned by the BatchImportEvidenceToAssessmentControl API.

refs.Evidence$eventName: The name of the specified evidence event.

Evidence.base: A record that contains the information needed to demonstrate compliance with the requirements specified by a control. Examples of evidence include change activity triggered by a user, or a system configuration snapshot.

refs.GetEvidenceResponse$evidence: The evidence returned by the GetEvidenceResponse API.

refs.Evidence$attributes: The names and values used by the evidence event, including an attribute name (such as allowUsersToChangePassword) and value (such as true or false).

refs.GetEvidenceByEvidenceFolderResponse$evid: The list of evidence returned by the GetEvidenceByEvidenceFolder API.

refs.AssessmentControl$evidenceSources: The list of data sources for the specified evidence.

refs.AssessmentFrameworkMetadata$logo: The logo associated with the framework.
refs.Framework$logo: The logo associated with the framework.
refs.FrameworkMetadata$logo: The logo associated with the framework.

Framework.base: The file used to structure and automate AWS Audit Manager assessments for a given compliance standard.

refs.CreateAssessmentFrameworkResponse$framew: The name of the new framework returned by the CreateAssessmentFramework API.
refs.GetAssessmentFrameworkResponse$framework: The framework returned by the GetAssessmentFramework API.
refs.UpdateAssessmentFrameworkResponse$framew: The name of the specified framework.

refs.AssessmentFrameworkMetadata$description: The description of the specified framework.
refs.CreateAssessmentFrameworkRequest$descrip: An optional description for the new custom framework.
refs.Framework$description: The description of the specified framework.
refs.UpdateAssessmentFrameworkRequest$descrip: The description of the framework that is to be updated.

FrameworkMetadata.base: The metadata of a framework, such as the name, ID, description, and so on.

refs.ListAssessmentFrameworksResponse$framewo: The list of metadata objects for the specified framework.

refs.AssessmentFrameworkMetadata$name: The name of the specified framework.
refs.CreateAssessmentFrameworkRequest$name: The name of the new custom framework.
refs.Framework$name: The name of the specified framework.
refs.UpdateAssessmentFrameworkRequest$name: The name of the framework to be updated.

refs.AssessmentFrameworkMetadata$type: The framework type, such as standard or custom.
refs.Framework$type: The framework type, such as custom or standard.
refs.ListAssessmentFrameworksRequest$framewor: The type of framework, such as standard or custom.

refs.Resource$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the specified resource.

refs.URL$hyperlinkName: The name or word used as a hyperlink to the URL.

refs.ChangeLog$createdBy: The IAM user or role that performed the action.
refs.CreateDelegationRequest$roleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.
refs.Delegation$roleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.
refs.DelegationMetadata$roleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.
refs.Evidence$iamId: The unique identifier for the IAM user or role associated with the evidence.
refs.Role$roleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.

refs.AssessmentControl$evidenceCount: The amount of evidence generated for the control.
refs.AssessmentControl$assessmentReportEviden: The amount of evidence in the assessment report.
refs.AssessmentControlSet$systemEvidenceCount: The total number of evidence objects retrieved automatically for the control set.
refs.AssessmentControlSet$manualEvidenceCount: The total number of evidence objects uploaded manually to the control set.
refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$totalEvidence: The total amount of evidence in the evidence folder.
refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$assessmentRepor: The total count of evidence included in the assessment report.
refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$evidenceResourc: The amount of evidence included in the evidence folder.
refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$evidenceByTypeC: The number of evidence that falls under the configuration data category. This evidence is collected from configuration snapshots of other AWS services such as Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, or IAM.
refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$evidenceByTypeM: The number of evidence that falls under the manual category. This evidence is imported manually.
refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$evidenceByTypeC: The number of evidence that falls under the compliance check category. This evidence is collected from AWS Config or AWS Security Hub.
The total number of issues that were reported directly from AWS Security Hub, AWS Config, or both.
refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$evidenceByTypeU: The number of evidence that falls under the user activity category. This evidence is collected from AWS CloudTrail logs.
refs.AssessmentEvidenceFolder$evidenceAwsServ: The total number of AWS resources assessed to generate the evidence.

InternalServerException.base: An internal service error occurred during the processing of your request. Try again later.

refs.SourceKeyword$keywordInputType: The method of input for the specified keyword.

refs.SourceKeyword$keywordValue: The value of the keyword used to search AWS CloudTrail logs when mapping a control data source.

refs.ListKeywordsForDataSourceResponse$keywor: The list of keywords for the specified event mapping source.

refs.Control$lastUpdatedBy: The IAM user or role that most recently updated the control.
refs.Framework$lastUpdatedBy: The IAM user or role that most recently updated the framework.

refs.ListAssessmentsResponse$assessmentMetada: The metadata associated with the assessment.

ManualEvidence.base: Evidence that is uploaded to AWS Audit Manager manually.

refs.BatchImportEvidenceToAssessmentControlEr: Manual evidence that cannot be collected automatically by AWS Audit Manager.

refs.BatchImportEvidenceToAssessmentControlRe: The list of manual evidence objects.

refs.GetChangeLogsRequest$maxResults: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.GetDelegationsRequest$maxResults: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.GetEvidenceByEvidenceFolderRequest$maxRe: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.GetEvidenceFoldersByAssessmentControlReq: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.GetEvidenceFoldersByAssessmentRequest$ma: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.ListAssessmentFrameworksRequest$maxResul: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.ListAssessmentReportsRequest$maxResults: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.ListAssessmentsRequest$maxResults: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.ListControlsRequest$maxResults: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.ListKeywordsForDataSourceRequest$maxResu: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.
refs.ListNotificationsRequest$maxResults: Represents the maximum number of results per page, or per API request call.

refs.AssessmentControlSet$description: The description for the control set.
refs.ChangeLog$objectName: The name of the changelog object.
refs.DelegationMetadata$controlSetName: Specifies the name of the control set delegated for review.
refs.Notification$controlSetName: Specifies the name of the control set that the notification is about.
refs.ServiceMetadata$displayName: The display name of the AWS service.
refs.ServiceMetadata$description: The description of the specified AWS service.
refs.ServiceMetadata$category: The category in which the AWS service belongs, such as compute, storage, database, and so on.

Notification.base: The notification used to inform a user of an update in AWS Audit Manager. For example, this includes the notification that is sent when a control set is delegated for review.

refs.ChangeLog$objectType: The changelog object type, such as an assessment, control, or control set.

Resource.base: A system asset that is evaluated in an AWS Audit Manager assessment.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: The resource specified in the request cannot be found.

refs.Evidence$resourcesIncluded: The list of resources assessed to generate the evidence.

Role.base: The wrapper that contains AWS Audit Manager role information, such as the role type and IAM Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

refs.CreateDelegationRequest$roleType:
The type of customer persona.

In CreateAssessment, roleType can only be PROCESS_OWNER.

In UpdateSettings, roleType can only be PROCESS_OWNER.

In BatchCreateDelegationByAssessment, roleType can only be RESOURCE_OWNER.
refs.Delegation$roleType:
The type of customer persona.

In CreateAssessment, roleType can only be PROCESS_OWNER.

In UpdateSettings, roleType can only be PROCESS_OWNER.

In BatchCreateDelegationByAssessment, roleType can only be RESOURCE_OWNER.
refs.Role$roleType:
The type of customer persona.

In CreateAssessment, roleType can only be PROCESS_OWNER.

In UpdateSettings, roleType can only be PROCESS_OWNER.

In BatchCreateDelegationByAssessment, roleType can only be RESOURCE_OWNER.
